content.description: A bit of dirty rock low through the chert bands leads to a gray sandpaper section past a barrel cactus towards the top.
content.location: 1st route left of In the Spotlight.

content.description: Seems about 5.9ish. Starts in a feature with a crack and overhang. Trends up and left past a blocky corner to anchors out left.
content.location: Between TV Guide and In the Spotlight

content.description: Steep start for 1 bolt, then fun and cruiser.  Another route that is surprisingly easy on the hands.  A good candidate for cold weather, or your first route of the day, before the bees at the top wake up.
content.location: Left of the long route with the blue slab at the top (Direct TV)

content.description:
6 bolts along the right side of the dihedral, leads to a two bolt anchor shared with the route on the right, Blood, Sweat and Tears. 

 Climb halfway up Ten for Two and cut left over the bulge to climb the 5.10a, Glorious Kaos, to a separate anchor.
content.location: The second route from the right on Suburban Crag.

content.description: Start on the right side of the cave. Run it out to the first bolt, pull up and start heading leftward. Fairly moderate and fun climbing leads to a brief steep section near the top of the cave.  I suggest staying right and clipping the bolt from the side.  Above, more easy terrain leads to a final head wall and the crux both physically and mentally.  If you got rained off your trad climb, you might enjoy this rig.
content.protection: 13 bolts to mussys.  Could be lowered into the cave if climbing on a shorter rope.
content.location: Just right of the tallest cave.

content.description:
P1: follows the chert up on balancy moves using somewhat delicate crimps. Very runout, probably 25' to first bolt on ~5.9 climbing (usually runouts at this crag are on very easy ground but this was sketchy). Single best pitch under 5.11 at Suburban Crag. Erik's Arete is a close second.

 P2: after chert ends, gains a large ledge and then goes up a slightly overhung wall using a series of horizontal cracks and textured smears. Allegedly 5.9, but felt like stout 5.10- to me... you be the judge!

 P3 (optional): one 5.8 move off the P2 anchors, but no bolts until the chains... P3 allows for summit top out and better rap position.

Two 35m raps to the ground.
content.protection: 7 bolts per pitch and chain anchors at the end of each
content.location:
P1 (5.10c): just to the left of

Blu-Ray (the non-direct variation), it's the first route right if the cave. Anchors are easier to see if you step back from the wall about 15', they're just below and left of a pink cactus. 7 BOLTS

 P2 (5.10a/b): goes up and right from chains. 7 BOLTS

 (Optional) P3 (5.easy): 25' up and left to another set of chain anchors. Rock quality up and right of P2 chains is suspect. 0 BOLTS

content.description: Fun climbing leads through a tricky crux over the bulge.
content.location: The next route to the left of Glorious Kaos.

content.description: A long pitch, with an easy bottom and formidable looking upper section.  ~5.9 climbing on loose rock down low leads to a ~20 ft runout over easy, solid rock up to a ledge, above which the rock is considerably more solid. Carefully hang the draw above the ledge and crimp your way through the fun, cruxy face. Squeeze into a dihedral for a nice rest, then pull the small roof/bulge to the anchors just above (not visible from the ground).
The middle variation in the corner, both in difficulty and position.
content.location: In the first cluster of routes you come to, this is on the left (uphill) side of the short overhung block that creates a dihedral on both sides.

content.description: Sharing the start with Erik's Arete, route goes up the corner to the left of Erik's Arete to a set of anchors.  The first 3 bolts are shared with Erik's Arete.

This climb can be found left of the large cave and is listed #3 on the suburban crag topo.P1.   5.9. Follow 6 Bolts to an anchor with rap rings. Relatively easy for grade with a short crux. Feels like an approach pitch. Loose block at anchor ledge. P2.   5.11a. 7 Bolts to mussy hooks. Work carefully through the first three bolts to enter pumpy vertical section. Climbing eases towards the end.
content.location: 2 routes left of the cave, see topo.

content.description: Climb small slots and underclings to a left-facing flake. Easy climbing above the flake to the anchors.See drawn topo for more info on this and the other climbs on this wall: SuburbanTopo
Climb half-way up the 5.8, Ten for Two, then cut left over the bulge, following bolts to a separate two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the third route from the right at Suburban Crag, it shares the same first half of the route, Ten for Two.

content.description: Fun climbing up the arête that is on the left side of the bulge. There are two variants that split off from this climb to the left, mid-way up, both are rated easier than this climb.
content.location: This is the arête to the left of NLV.

content.description: Fun climbing through exceptionally cherty bands, then it slabs out near the top on the smooth blue-grey limestone.
content.location: There is about a 20 foot gap of low angle rock between this route and the routes on the right, ie., Erik's Arête.

content.description:
Shares the first pitch with In Your Eye, and takes the right variation above the anchor.   Big holds, good feet, and comfortable rock.  This thing looks improbable and yet flows really well.  The big features give it a trad feel.  

 Take off from the anchor on big feet and balancey side pulls and make your way up toward the roof.   Crux is deciphering which holds to use to clip the bolt below the roof.  After that, each 5.10 move rewards you with a rest to keep the grade down.  Send and enjoy.
content.protection: 8 bolts to chains on the second pitch
content.location: Locate the shared anchor with the other multipitch, a double ring anchor above a large rock nettle.

content.description: Follow 10 bolts to an anchor. The route is mostly 5.9 or easier with a short 5.10 crux, fun pockets.
Crux is avoiding the sticky velcro plant in the small dihedral. Fun climbing other than that.
content.location: 2rd route right of the cave. Starts below the small right facing dihedral. The route merges with Blu-Ray Direct about 2/3 of the way up.

content.description: Four bolts leads to a two bolt anchor shared with the route on the left, Ten for Two.
content.location: The first route on the right side of the wall. This is the first route encountered as you hike up to Suburban Crag.

content.description: Traverse awkwardly until the third bolt where the quality of the climb improves greatly. Trend right passing the anchors for the cave routes. A sharp slabby finish will get you to the chains equipped with carabiners.
content.location: The route climbs the left side of the lip of the cave.

content.description:
23 Routes bolted mostly by Leo Henson.  A good post rain crag in the winter.   

  See drawn topo here: 

SuburbanTopo

  Faces south and bakes in the sun.  Pretty much a winter only crag.
